column4: no good. My camera doesn't even come up as a fremovable drive. It says it can't be mounted
done that. My camera comes up with swithc to USB ode when i connect the cable, but my computer won't recognise it as a drive.
Samsung Kenox Q1
I also tried to use my SD card, but ubuntu doesn't receive any support for SD cards.
How does slavik use SD cards in ubuntu.the forums also say there is no support.
I have a USB card reader which has Linux support ,but it won't read this card or connect via USB! &*)**&^
the card works fine in Windows, just not in Linux.
alright... connect the card reader, and then enter the command "sudo lsusb"
I don't know if ubuntu comes with lsusb by default though...
okay... good so far...
try not to spam the channel ;)
alright... is that myson thing your card reader for sure?
I guess it could  be the card... how are you trying to mount it?
FWIW, my card reader shows up in lsusb, but I know it's dead :(
does the card reader show up in the GUI? somewhere in nautilis?
okay... does it give a reason for refusing mounting?
hmm... tricky...
do you have any idea what the mount option in question is?
that won't help at all
I'm thinking you need to configure your /etc/fstab...
okay... do a "sudu gedit /etc/fstab"
don't be frightened by the syntax... it's not _that_ difficult
got it?
see the file things on the left? see the column that has /dev/? look for any devices that have "sd" in their name. sd stands for serial device, and usb is serial...
do you see any sd devices?
actually... I might be making this too hard... I just looked online and there seems to be an easier way to do this...
wait, do you know if you're using sata for your hard drive or not?
alright...
open another terminal and enter the command "pmount /dev/sda1 flash"
it might error out... if it does, try "pmount /dev/sdb flash"
I've never used pmount before... I'm experimenting on you ;)
only a warning, ehh? see if it worked...
browse to /media/flash
okay... we need to find where your flash drive is in /dev. try "sudo fdisk -l". but don't just copy/paste the output, tell me which "sd" drives you see
okay... the hdas are probably your hard drive's partitions...
try this command.... the manual way: "sudu mkdir /media/flash && sudu mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /media/flash"
:D
err, I don't drink ;)
you should look into configuring fstab... that's probably what's wroing
skhobotu so... you still see fstab? do you see a line with sdb1 on it already?
okay... well, tell me the one line (only one line ;P) that the sdb1 is on
no biggie, it's sudo gedit /etc/fstab
I'm guessing the "mount option" that was causing your problem resides in /etc/fstab
how do i resolve the probmem in fstab?
okay...
paste the one line that you see /dev/sdb1 on
what next?
/dev/sdb1  /media/sdb1    ntfs nls=iso8859-1,users,umask=000,gid=users,user,owner,uid=root  0  0
okay, you see that part with all the commas in it? that looks like cruft that colud mess everything up...
change it so that it says simply "users,auto" instead
ohh, and.... I don't think it's ntfs either
change the "ntfs" to say "vfat"
and you can change the "/media/sdb1" to say "/media/flash"
done
after that... you can test it by trying "sudo umount /media/flash" and then "sudo mount /media/flash"
make sure you write the file first though ;)
OK
so i just save the file I have open and that will do it??
yeah, you need to save the config... that's how things work ;)
Sorry :used to windows point and click!!
how'd it go? after you ran those commands, could you still access the directory?
okay....
it was working a minute ago with the "mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /media/flash", right?
didn't that command I told you earlyer work? the fstab should have worked, i'm supprised...
sure... "sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /media/flash"
so... does that command work or not? are you able to browse your card's files?
okay... well... i'll check if your fstab is right... gimme a sec to formulate a good fstab line...
your fstab should read "/dev/sdb1 /media/flash vfat users,auto 0 0"
alright, did you make sure that line in your fstab looked exactly like I made it?
okay...
paste your fstab here and let me look at it http://pastebin.com/
perfect, I see your problem ;)
paste it to pastebin.com and give me the url
http://pastebin.com/m36696aa9
thanks
no, that's not what I meant... can you paste your whole /etc/fstab file in there?
I can't really see line 15 if I don't have the file ;P
http://pastebin.com/db4730eb
it now says I can't mount it because i don'thave enough privileges
see line 15 and 16? they should be one line
all you have to do is make line 16 go on the end of line 15... making one line
easy
okay... now try unmounting it and mounting it again... you can probably use the gui this time
huh...
on the command line, does "sudo umount /media/flash && sudo mount /media/flash" work?
sorry, I meant umount :/
I'm bad today X-D
tried sudo unmount :/

okay... I'm not sure what's wrong exactly... I need to go to bed right now... as long as that "sudo mount /media/flash" command works, you'll be fine. if that doesn't work, "sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /mnt/flash" will... just write those things down...
that looks perfect, I don't know what's wrong with the gui....
anyway... 'night... I hope you figure it out :/
what the initial command line for mounting the camera card?
